hadad_1338.name: Hadad (Bedad)
hadad_1338.bio: An Edomite king who defeated the Midianites ([Gen. 36:35](/gen#Gen.36.35); [1 Chr. 1:46](/1chr#1Chr.1.46)).

hadad_1339.name: Hadad (The Edomite.)
hadad_1339.bio: One of “the king’s seed in Edom.” He fled into Egypt, where he married the sister of Pharaoh’s wife ([1 Kings 11:14-22](/1kgs#1Kgs.11.14)). He became one of Solomon’s adversaries. Hadad, sharp, (a different name in Hebrew from the preceding), one of the sons of Ishmael ([1 Chr.

hadad_1342.name: Hadad (king of Edom)
hadad_1342.bio: One of the Edomitish kings ([Gen. 36:39](/gen#Gen.36.39)) about the time of Saul. Called also Hadad ([1 Chr.

hadar_1341.name: Hadar
hadar_1341.bio: A son of Ishmael ([Gen. 25:15](/gen#Gen.25.15)); in [1 Chr. 1:30](/1chr#1Chr.1.30) written Hadad.

hadarezer_1340.name: Hadarezer
hadarezer_1340.bio: Hadad is help; called also Hadarezer, Adod is his help, the king of Zobah. Hanun, the king of the Ammonites, hired among others the army of Hadadezer to assist him in his war against David. Joab, who was sent against this confederate host, found them in double battle array, the Ammonities toward their capital of Rabbah, and the Syrian mercenaries near Medeba.

hadlai_1344.name: Hadlai
hadlai_1344.bio: Resting, an Ephraimite; the father of Amasa, mentioned in [2 Chr. 28:12](/2chr#2Chr.28.12).

hadoram_1345.name: Hadoram
hadoram_1345.bio: The fifth son of Joktan, the founder of an Arab tribe ([Gen. 10:27](/gen#Gen.10.27); [1 Chr. 1:21](/1chr#1Chr.1.21)).

hagar_1348.name: Hagar
hagar_1348.bio: Flight, or, according to others, stranger, an Egyptian, Sarah’s handmaid ([Gen. 16:1](/gen#Gen.16.1); [21:9](/gen#Gen.21.9), [10](/gen#Gen.21.10)), whom she gave to Abraham (q.v.) as a secondary wife (16:2). When she was about to become a mother she fled from the cruelty of her mistress, intending apparently to return to her relatives in Egypt, through the desert of Shur, which lay between.

haggai_1349.name: Haggai
haggai_1349.bio: Festive, one of the twelve so-called minor prophets. He was the first of the three (Zechariah, his contemporary, and Malachi, who was about one hundred years later, being the other two) whose ministry belonged to the period of Jewish history which began after the return from captivity in Babylon. Scarcely anything is known of his personal history.

haggith_1353.name: Haggith
haggith_1353.bio: Festive; the dancer, a wife of David and the mother of Adonijah ([2 Sam. 3:4](/2sam#2Sam.3.4); [1 Kings 1:5](/1kgs#1Kgs.1.5), [11](/1kgs#1Kgs.1.11); 2:13; [1 Chr. 3:2](/1chr#1Chr.3.2)), who, like Absalom, was famed for his beauty.

hakkoz_1355.name: Hakkoz
hakkoz_1355.bio: The thorn, the head of one of the courses of the priests ([1 Chr. 24:10](/1chr#1Chr.24.10)).

ham_1359.name: Ham
ham_1359.bio: Warm, hot, and hence the south; also an Egyptian word meaning “black”, the youngest son of Noah ([Gen. 5:32](/gen#Gen.5.32); comp. 9:22, 24).

haman_1360.name: Haman
haman_1360.bio: (of Persian origin), magnificent, the name of the vizier (i.e., the prime minister) of the Persian king Ahasuerus ([Esther 3:1](/esth#Esth.3.1), etc.). He is called an “Agagite,” which seems to denote that he was descended from the royal family of the Amalekites, the bitterest enemies of the Jews, as Agag was one of the titles of the Amalekite kings. He or his parents were brought to Persia as captives taken in war.

hammedatha_1362.name: Hammedatha
hammedatha_1362.bio: Father of Haman, designated usually “the Agagite” ([Esther 3:1](/esth#Esth.3.1), [10](/esth#Esth.3.10); [8:5](/esth#Esth.8.5)).

hammelech_1363.name: Hammelech
hammelech_1363.bio: The king’s, the father of Jerahmeel, mentioned in [Jer. 36:26](/jer#Jer.36.26). Some take this word as a common noun, “the king”, and understand that Jerahmeel was Jehoiakim’s son.

hammoleketh_1364.name: Hammoleketh
hammoleketh_1364.bio: The queen, the daughter of Machir and sister of Gilead ([1 Chr. 7:17](/1chr#1Chr.7.17), [18](/1chr#1Chr.7.18)). Abiezer was one of her three children.

hamor_1365.name: Hamor
hamor_1365.bio: he-ass, a Hivite from whom Jacob purchased the plot of ground in which Joseph was afterwards buried ( Genesis 33:19 ). He is called "Emmor" in Acts 7:16 . His son Shechem founded the city of that name which Simeon and Levi destroyed because of his crime in the matter of Dinah, Jacob's daughter ( Genesis 34:20 ).

hamul_1367.name: Hamul
hamul_1367.bio: Spared, one of the sons of Pharez, son of Judah ([1 Chr. 2:5](/1chr#1Chr.2.5)). His descendants are called Hamulites ([Num.

hamutal_1368.name: Hamutal
hamutal_1368.bio: Kinsman of the dew, the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah, wife of king Josiah, and mother of king Jehoahaz ([2 Kings 23:31](/2kgs#2Kgs.23.31)), also of king Zedekiah ([2 Kings 24:18](/2kgs#2Kgs.24.18)).

hanameel_1369.name: Hanameel
hanameel_1369.bio: Whom God has graciously given, the cousin of Jeremiah, to whom he sold the field he possessed in Anathoth, before the siege of Jerusalem ([Jer. 32:6-12](/jer#Jer.32.6)).

hanan_1371.name: Hanan (When Baal-Hanan son of Akbor died)

hanan_1374.name: Hanan (Levite)
hanan_1374.bio: One of the Levites who assisted Ezra ([Neh. 8:7](/neh#Neh.8.7)).

hanan_1375.name: Hanan (subscribed the covenant)
hanan_1375.bio: One of the chiefs who subscribed the covenant ([Neh. 10:22](/neh#Neh.10.22)).

hanan_1378.name: Hanan (One of the chiefs who subscribed the cov)

hanani_1379.name: Hanani (Prophet)
hanani_1379.bio: A prophet who was sent to rebuke king Asa for entering into a league with Benhadad I., king of Syria, against Judah ([2 Chr. 16:1-10](/2chr#2Chr.16.1)). He was probably the father of the prophet Jehu ([1 Kings 16:7](/1kgs#1Kgs.16.7)).

hanani_1380.name: Hanani (God has gratified me)
hanani_1380.bio: One of the sons of Heman ([1 Chr. 25:4](/1chr#1Chr.25.4), [25](/1chr#1Chr.25.25)).

hanani_1382.name: Hanani (A son of Heman)
hanani_1382.bio: Probably a brother of Nehemiah ([Neh. 1:2](/neh#Neh.1.2); [7:2](/neh#Neh.7.2)), who reported to him the melancholy condition of Jerusalem. Nehemiah afterwards appointed him to have charge of the city gates.

hananiah_1385.name: Hananiah (Jehovah has given. A chief of the tribe)
hananiah_1385.bio: A chief of the tribe of Benjamin ([1 Chr. 8:24](/1chr#1Chr.8.24)).

hananiah_1386.name: Hananiah (the false prophet)
hananiah_1386.bio: One of the sons of Heman ([1 Chr. 25:4](/1chr#1Chr.25.4), [23](/1chr#1Chr.25.23)).

hananiah_1387.name: Hananiah (a member of the king's staff)
hananiah_1387.bio: One of Uzziah’s military officers ([2 Chr. 26:11](/2chr#2Chr.26.11)).

hananiah_1389.name: Hananiah (general in the army of King Uzziah)

hananiah_1391.name: Hananiah (the prince of the palace in Jerusalem)
hananiah_1391.bio: The “ruler of the palace; he was a faithful man, and feared God above many” ([Neh. 7:2](/neh#Neh.7.2)).

hananiah_1396.name: Hananiah (A chief of the tribe of Benjamin)

hananiah_1397.name: Hananiah (son of Zerubbabel)
hananiah_1397.bio: Grandfather of the captain who arrested Jeremiah ([Jer. 37:13](/jer#Jer.37.13)).

haniel_1399.name: Haniel
haniel_1399.bio: A chief of the tribe of Asher ([1 Chr. 7:39](/1chr#1Chr.7.39)).

hannah_1400.name: Hannah
hannah_1400.bio: Favour, grace, one of the wives of Elkanah the Levite, and the mother of Samuel ([1 Sam. 1](/1sam#1Sam.1); [2](/1sam#1Sam.2)). Her home was at Ramathaim-zophim, whence she was wont every year to go to Shiloh, where the tabernacle had been pitched by Joshua, to attend the offering of sacrifices there according to the law ([Ex.

hanniel_1401.name: Hanniel
hanniel_1401.bio: A chief of the tribe of Manasseh ([Num. 34:23](/num#Num.34.23)).

hanun_1404.name: Hanun (2 Samuel 10:1 1 Chronicles 19:1)
hanun_1404.bio: The son and successor of Nahash, king of Moab. David’s messengers, sent on an embassy of condolence to him to Rabbah Ammon, his capital, were so grossly insulted that he proclaimed war against Hanun. David’s army, under the command of Joab, forthwith crossed the Jordan, and gained a complete victory over the Moabites and their allies ([2 Sam.

haran_1407.name: Haran (and Haran died in his native city)
haran_1407.bio: Heb. haran; i.e., “mountaineer.” The eldest son of Terah, brother of Abraham and Nahor, and father of Lot, Milcah, and Iscah. He died before his father ([Gen.

haran_1408.name: Haran (father of Gazez)
haran_1408.bio: The son of Caleb of Judah ([1 Chr. 2:46](/1chr#1Chr.2.46)) by his concubine Ephah.

harbona_1410.name: Harbona
harbona_1410.bio: (a Persian word meaning “ass-driver”), one of the seven eunuchs or chamberlains of king Ahasuerus ([Esther 1:10](/esth#Esth.1.10); [7:9](/esth#Esth.7.9)).

harhaiah_1413.name: Harhaiah
harhaiah_1413.bio: Zeal of Jehovah, ([Neh. 3:8](/neh#Neh.3.8)) “of the goldsmiths,” one whose son helped to repair the wall of Jerusalem.

harim_1416.name: Harim (A priest)
harim_1416.bio: The head of the second course of priests ([1 Chr. 24:8](/1chr#1Chr.24.8)).

harim_1418.name: Harim (The head of the second course of priests)

harnepher_1420.name: Harnepher
harnepher_1420.bio: A chief of the tribe of Asher ([1 Chr. 7:36](/1chr#1Chr.7.36)).

harsha_1422.name: Harsha
harsha_1422.bio: Worker or enchanter, one of the Nethinim ([Ezra 2:52](/ezra#Ezra.2.52); [Neh. 7:54](/neh#Neh.7.54)).

harum_1423.name: Harum
harum_1423.bio: Elevated, ([1 Chr. 4:8](/1chr#1Chr.4.8)), a descendant of Judah.

haruz_1425.name: Haruz
haruz_1425.bio: Eager, the father of Meshullemeth, the wife of king Manasseh ([2 Kings 21:19](/2kgs#2Kgs.21.19)) and mother of king Amon.

hasadiah_1426.name: Hasadiah
hasadiah_1426.bio: Favoured by Jehovah, one of the sons of Pedaiah ([1 Chr. 3:20](/1chr#1Chr.3.20)), of the royal line of David.

hasenuah_1427.name: Hasenuah
hasenuah_1427.bio: Bristling or hated, a Benjamite ([1 Chr. 9:7](/1chr#1Chr.9.7)).

hashabiah_1429.name: Hashabiah (one of the Levite leaders in the time of)

hashabiah_1431.name: Hashabiah (From the Hebronites: Hashabiah and his r)

hashabiah_1433.name: Hashabiah (chief of levites)
hashabiah_1433.bio: One of the chief Levites ([2 Chr. 35:9](/2chr#2Chr.35.9)).

hashabiah_1434.name: Hashabiah (son of Bunni)
hashabiah_1434.bio: One of the chief priests in the time of Ezra ([Ezra 8:24](/ezra#Ezra.8.24)).

hashabniah_1440.name: Hashabniah (the Levite)
hashabniah_1440.bio: One of the Levites whom Ezra appointed to interpret the law to the people ([Neh. 9:5](/neh#Neh.9.5)).

hashbadana_1441.name: Hashbadana
hashbadana_1441.bio: Consideration in judging, stood at Ezra’s left hand when he read the law ([Neh. 8:4](/neh#Neh.8.4)).

hashubah_1445.name: Hashubah
hashubah_1445.bio: Ibid., a descendant of David ([1 Chr. 3:20](/1chr#1Chr.3.20)).

hashum_1447.name: Hashum (and according to the Bible the name coul)
hashum_1447.bio: Stood on Ezra’s left hand while he read the law ([Neh. 8:4](/neh#Neh.8.4)).

hasrah_1414.name: Hasrah
hasrah_1414.bio: Poverty, “keeper of the wardrobe,” i.e., of the sacerdotal vestments ([2 Chr. 34:22](/2chr#2Chr.34.22)); called Harhas [2 Kings 22:14](/2kgs#2Kgs.22.14). He was husband of the prophetess Huldah.

hasshub_1450.name: Hasshub
hasshub_1450.bio: A Levite of the family of Merari ([Neh. 11:15](/neh#Neh.11.15); [1 Chr. 9:14](/1chr#1Chr.9.14)).

hatach_1452.name: Hatach
hatach_1452.bio: Verity, one of the eunuchs or chamberlains in the palace of Ahasuerus ([Esther 4:5](/esth#Esth.4.5), [6](/esth#Esth.4.6), [9](/esth#Esth.4.9), [10](/esth#Esth.4.10)).

hatita_1455.name: Hatita
hatita_1455.bio: Exploration, one of the temple porters or janitors ([Ezra 2:42](/ezra#Ezra.2.42)). He returned from Babylon with Zerubbabel.

hattush_1460.name: Hattush (A priest)
hattush_1460.bio: A priest who returned with Zerubbabel ([Neh. 12:2](/neh#Neh.12.2)).

havilah_1461.name: Havilah (A son of Cush)
havilah_1461.bio: One of the sons of Cush ([Gen. 10:7](/gen#Gen.10.7)).

hazael_1463.name: Hazael
hazael_1463.bio: Whom God beholds, an officer of Ben-hadad II., king of Syria, who ultimately came to the throne, according to the word of the Lord to Elijah ([1 Kings 19:15](/1kgs#1Kgs.19.15)), after he had put the king to death ([2 Kings 8:15](/2kgs#2Kgs.8.15)). His interview with Elisha is mentioned in [2 Kings 8](/2kgs#2Kgs.8). The Assyrians soon after his accession to the throne came against him and defeated him with very great loss; and three years afterwards again invaded Syria, but on this occasion Hazael submitted to them.

hazarmaveth_1465.name: Hazarmaveth
hazarmaveth_1465.bio: Court of death, the third son of Joktan, and a region in Arabia-Felix settled by him ([Gen. 10:26](/gen#Gen.10.26); [1 Chr. 1:20](/1chr#1Chr.1.20)).

hazo_1468.name: Hazo
hazo_1468.bio: Vision, one of the sons of Nahor ([Gen. 22:22](/gen#Gen.22.22)).

heber_1469.name: Heber (Malkiel)
heber_1469.bio: passing over. Son of Beriah and grandson of Asher ( Genesis 46:17 ; 1 Chronicles 7:31 1 Chronicles 7:32 ).

heber_1470.name: Heber (husband of Jael)
heber_1470.bio: The Kenite ([Judg. 4:11](/judg#Judg.4.11), [17](/judg#Judg.4.17); 5:24), a descendant of Hobab. His wife Jael received Sisera (q.v.) into her tent and then killed him.

heber_1472.name: Heber (Other Side or Orient. Eber or Heber was)
heber_1472.bio: One of the seven heads of the families of the Gadites ([1 Chr. 5:13](/1chr#1Chr.5.13)).

hebron_1475.name: Hebron (son of Kohath)
hebron_1475.bio: The third son of Kohath the Levite ([Ex. 6:18](/exod#Exod.6.18); [1 Chr. 6:2](/1chr#1Chr.6.2), [18](/1chr#1Chr.6.18)).

hegai_1477.name: Hegai
hegai_1477.bio: Eunuch, had charge of the harem of Ahasuerus ([Esther 2:8](/esth#Esth.2.8)).

helah_1478.name: Helah
helah_1478.bio: Rust, ([1 Chr. 4:5](/1chr#1Chr.4.5), [7](/1chr#1Chr.4.7)), one of the wives of Ashur.

heleb_1480.name: Heleb
heleb_1480.bio: Fatness, one of David’s warriors ([2 Sam. 23:29](/2sam#2Sam.23.29)).

heli_1484.name: Heli
heli_1484.bio: Elevation, father of Joseph in the line of our Lord’s ancestry ([Luke 3:23](/luke#Luke.3.23)).

helkai_1485.name: Helkai
helkai_1485.bio: Smooth-tongued, one of the chief priests in the time of Joiakim ([Neh. 12:15](/neh#Neh.12.15)).

helon_1486.name: Helon
helon_1486.bio: Strong, father of Eliab, who was “captain of the children of Zebulun” ([Num. 1:9](/num#Num.1.9); [2:7](/num#Num.2.7)).

heman_1488.name: Heman (the Ezrahite)
heman_1488.bio: [1 Kings 4:31](/1kgs#1Kgs.4.31); [1 Chr. 2:6](/1chr#1Chr.2.6), a son of Zerah, noted for his wisdom.

heman_1489.name: Heman (Grandson of Samuel)
heman_1489.bio: [1 Kings 4:31](/1kgs#1Kgs.4.31); [1 Chr. 2:6](/1chr#1Chr.2.6), a son of Zerah, noted for his wisdom.

heman_1490.name: Heman (the Ezrahite)
heman_1490.bio: Grandson of Samuel ([1 Chr. 6:33](/1chr#1Chr.6.33); [15:17](/1chr#1Chr.15.17)), to whom the 88th Psalm probably was inscribed. He was one of the “seers” named in [2 Chr.

henadad_1493.name: Henadad (Binnui is one of  Henadad's son)
henadad_1493.bio: Favour of Hadad, the name of a Levite after the Captivity ([Ezra 3:9](/ezra#Ezra.3.9)).

hepher_1497.name: Hepher (Descendant of Naarah)
hepher_1497.bio: The second son of Asher ([1 Chr. 4:6](/1chr#1Chr.4.6)).

hermogenes_1503.name: Hermogenes
hermogenes_1503.bio: Mercury-born, at one time Paul’s fellow-labourer in Asia Minor, who, however, afterwards abandoned him, along with one Phygellus, probably on account of the perils by which they were beset ([2 Tim. 1:15](/2tim#2Tim.1.15)).

herod_1505.name: Herod Antipas
herod_1505.bio: Herod's son by Malthace ( Matthew 14:1 ; Luke 3:1 Luke 3:19 ; 9:7 ; Acts 13:1 ). (See ANTIPAS .)

herod_1506.name: Herod Agrippa I
herod_1506.bio: son of Aristobulus and Bernice, and grandson of Herod the Great. He was made tetrarch of the provinces formerly held by Lysanias II., and ultimately possessed the entire kingdom of his grandfather, Herod the Great, with the title of king. He put the apostle James the elder to death, and cast Peter into prison ( Luke 3:1 ; Acts 12:1-19 ).

herodias_1507.name: Herodias
herodias_1507.bio: ([Matt. 14:3-11](/matt#Matt.14.3); [Mark 6:17-28](/mark#Mark.6.17); [Luke 3:19](/luke#Luke.3.19)), the daughter of Aristobulus and Bernice. While residing at Rome with her husband Herod Philip I.

herodion_1508.name: Herodion
herodion_1508.bio: A Christian at Rome whom Paul salutes and calls his “kinsman” ([Rom. 16:11](/rom#Rom.16.11)).

heth_1510.name: Heth
heth_1510.bio: Dread, a descendant of Canaan, and the ancestor of the Hittites ([Gen. 10:18](/gen#Gen.10.18); [Deut. 7:1](/deut#Deut.7.1)), who dwelt in the vicinity of Hebron ([Gen.

hezekiah_1512.name: Hezekiah (Son of Ahaz)
hezekiah_1512.bio: Son of Ahaz ([2 Kings 18:1](/2kgs#2Kgs.18.1); [2 Chr. 29:1](/2chr#2Chr.29.1)), whom he succeeded on the throne of the kingdom of Judah. He reigned twenty-nine years (B.C.

hezion_1515.name: Hezion
hezion_1515.bio: Vision, the father of Tabrimon, and grandfather of Ben-hadad, king of Syria ([1 Kings 15:18](/1kgs#1Kgs.15.18)).

hezir_1516.name: Hezir (not found)
hezir_1516.bio: The head of the seventeenth course of the priests ([1 Chr. 24:15](/1chr#1Chr.24.15)).

hezrai_1518.name: Hezrai
hezrai_1518.bio: A Carmelite, one of David’s warriors ([1 Chr. 11:37](/1chr#1Chr.11.37)).

hezron_1519.name: Hezron (The tribe of Reuben descended from Reube)
hezron_1519.bio: One of the sons of Reuben ([Gen. 46:9](/gen#Gen.46.9); [Ex. 6:14](/exod#Exod.6.14)).

hezron_1520.name: Hezron ((Hebrew: חֶצְרוֹן)
hezron_1520.bio: The older of the two sons of Pharez ([Gen. 46:12](/gen#Gen.46.12)).

hiel_1522.name: Hiel
hiel_1522.bio: Life of (i.e., from) God, a native of Bethel, who built (i.e., fortified) Jericho some seven hundred years after its destruction by the Israelites. There fell on him for such an act the imprecation of Joshua (6:26). He laid the foundation in his first-born, and set up the gates in his youngest son ([1 Kings 16:34](/1kgs#1Kgs.16.34)), i.e., during the progress of the work all his children died.

hilkiah_1524.name: Hilkiah (High Priest of the Temple)
hilkiah_1524.bio: The high priest in the reign of Josiah ([1 Chr. 6:13](/1chr#1Chr.6.13); [Ezra 7:1](/ezra#Ezra.7.1)). To him and his deputy ([2 Kings 23:5](/2kgs#2Kgs.23.5)), along with the ordinary priests and the Levites who had charge of the gates, was entrusted the purification of the temple in Jerusalem.

hilkiah_1527.name: Hilkiah (who was the son of Shallum and the fathe)

hilkiah_1528.name: Hilkiah (These were the leaders of the priests an)

hillel_1530.name: Hillel
hillel_1530.bio: Praising, a Pirathonite, father of the judge Abdon ([Judg. 12:13](/judg#Judg.12.13), [15](/judg#Judg.12.15)).

hiram_1532.name: Hiram (King of Tyre)
hiram_1532.bio: Also “Huram” and “Horam,” king of Tyre. He entered into an alliance with David, and assisted him in building his palace by sending him able workmen, and also cedar-trees and fir-trees from Lebanon ([2 Sam. 5:11](/2sam#2Sam.5.11); [1 Chr.

hiram_1533.name: Hiram (I was the Phoenician king of Tyre accord)
hiram_1533.bio: The “master workman” whom Hiram sent to Solomon. He was the son of a widow of Dan, and of a Tyrian father. In [2 Chr.

hivite_1534.name: Hivite
hivite_1534.bio: One of the original tribes scattered over Palestine, from Hermon to Gibeon in the south. The name is interpreted as “midlanders” or “villagers” ([Gen. 10:17](/gen#Gen.10.17); [1 Chr.

hobab_1537.name: Hobab
hobab_1537.bio: Beloved, the Kenite, has been usually identified with Jethro (q.v.), [Ex. 18:5](/exod#Exod.18.5), [27](/exod#Exod.18.27); comp. [Num.

hodijah_1545.name: Hodijah (The Levite)
hodijah_1545.bio: One of the Levites who assisted Ezra in expounding the law ([Neh. 8:7](/neh#Neh.8.7); [9:5](/neh#Neh.9.5)).

hodijah_1547.name: Hodijah (majesty of Jehovah)
hodijah_1547.bio: [Neh. 10:18](/neh#Neh.10.18), a Levite who sealed the covenant.

hoglah_1548.name: Hoglah
hoglah_1548.bio: Partridge, one of the daughters of Zelophehad the Gileadite, to whom portions were assigned by Moses ([Num. 26:33](/num#Num.26.33); [27:1](/num#Num.27.1); [36:11](/num#Num.36.11)).

hoham_1549.name: Hoham
hoham_1549.bio: Jehovah impels, the king of Hebron who joined the league against Gibeon. He and his allies were defeated ([Josh. 10:3](/josh#Josh.10.3), [5](/josh#Josh.10.5), [16](/josh#Josh.10.16)-27).

holy_spirit_7400.name: Holy Spirit
holy_spirit_7400.bio: the third Person of the adorable Trinity. His personality is proved (1) from the fact that the attributes of personality, as intelligence and volition, are ascribed to him ( John 14:17 John 14:26 ; 15:26 ; 1 Corinthians 2:10 1 Corinthians 2:11 ; 12:11 ). He reproves, helps, glorifies, intercedes ( John 16:7-13 ; Romans 8:26 ).

hophni_1550.name: Hophni
hophni_1550.bio: Pugilist or client, one of the two sons of Eli, the high priest ([1 Sam. 1:3](/1sam#1Sam.1.3); [2:34](/1sam#1Sam.2.34)), who, because he was “very old,” resigned to them the active duties of his office. By their scandalous conduct they brought down a curse on their father’s house (2:22, 12-27, 27-36; 3:11-14).

hori_1552.name: Hori (a prince; freeborn; name mean's cave dwe)

hosah_1554.name: Hosah
hosah_1554.bio: A Levite of the family of Merari ([1 Chr. 16:38](/1chr#1Chr.16.38)).

hosea_1555.name: Hosea
hosea_1555.bio: Salvation, the son of Beeri, and author of the book of prophecies bearing his name. He belonged to the kingdom of Israel. “His Israelitish origin is attested by the peculiar, rough, Aramaizing diction, pointing to the northern part of Palestine; by the intimate acquaintance he evinces with the localities of Ephraim (5:1; 6:8, 9; 12:12; 14:6, etc.); by passages like 1:2, where the kingdom is styled ‘the land’, and 7:5, where the Israelitish king is designated as ‘our’ king.” The period of his ministry (extending to some sixty years) is indicated in the superscription ([Hos.

hoshea_1559.name: Hoshea (king in the twentieth year of Jotham son)
hoshea_1559.bio: The last king of Israel. He conspired against and slew his predecessor, Pekah ([Isa. 7:16](/isa#Isa.7.16)), but did not ascend the throne till after an interregnum of warfare of eight years ([2 Kings 17:1](/2kgs#2Kgs.17.1), [2](/2kgs#2Kgs.17.2)).

hoshea_1560.name: Hoshea (Leader ove Ephraimites)
hoshea_1560.bio: [1 Chr. 27:20](/1chr#1Chr.27.20). The ruler of Ephraim in David’s time.

hotham_1562.name: Hotham
hotham_1562.bio: A stroke, great-grandson of Asher ([1 Chr. 7:35](/1chr#1Chr.7.35)).

hul_1566.name: Hul
hul_1566.bio: Circle, the second son of Aram ([Gen. 10:23](/gen#Gen.10.23)), and grandson of Shem.

huldah_1567.name: Huldah
huldah_1567.bio: Weasel, a prophetess; the wife of Shallum. She was consulted regarding the “book of the law” discovered by the high priest Hilkiah ([2 Kings 22:14-20](/2kgs#2Kgs.22.14); [2 Chr. 34:22-28](/2chr#2Chr.34.22)).

hur_1571.name: Hur (a companion of Moses and Aaron. He happe)
hur_1571.bio: The husband of Miriam, Moses’ sister ([Ex. 17:10-12](/exod#Exod.17.10)). He was associated with Aaron in charge of the people when Moses was absent on Sinai ([Ex.

hur_1572.name: Hur (prince of Midian)
hur_1572.bio: One of the five princes of Midian who were defeated and slain by the Israelites under the command of Phinehas ([Num. 31:8](/num#Num.31.8)).

hurai_1521.name: Hurai
hurai_1521.bio: Linen-worker, one of David’s heroes, a native of the valley of Mount Gaash ([1 Chr. 11:32](/1chr#1Chr.11.32)).

huram_1569.name: Huram (son)
huram_1569.bio: Generally “Huram,” one of the sons of Bela ([1 Chr. 8:5](/1chr#1Chr.8.5)).

hushai_1577.name: Hushai
hushai_1577.bio: Quick, “the Archite,” “the king’s friend” ([1 Chr. 27:33](/1chr#1Chr.27.33)). When David fled from Jerusalem, on account of the rebellion of Absalom, and had reached the summit of Olivet, he there met Hushai, whom he sent back to Jerusalem for the purpose of counteracting the influence of Ahithophel, who had joined the ranks of Absalom ([2 Sam.
